column4: hi guys, i need a real quick answer. how do i restrict persmissions so that a user only has access to thier home folder and cannot even read any other?
take them out of the sudoer's file and group and/or wheel group
just # them out? and that will work so that when they are on my ftp server they wil not be able to view other users file?

The most simple answer is just to comment each user in question out of the sudo'ers file. Without sudo permissions they will only be able to work in their home directory, but will still have access to /usr/bin/* commands (ls, python, grep, etc.)
please also make certain that they're not in the sudoers group or the wheel group.
